content.description: This is the north face of the boulder. It is 90 degree vertical face with great crimps all over. Jugs on the top make easy and safe topouts. Sit starts are about V1. Standing start is V easy. There are multiple ways to go about climbing it. Enjoy a good warm-up.
content.location: This is on the north face of the Hidden Boulder.

content.description: Acorn Dreams climbs on the west arete of the Hidden Boulder. It starts sitting underneath the arete with the left hand high on big, okay crimp on the crimper face. The right starts low in a three or four finger, full pad pocket. Set a heel or good toe hook on the bottom of the crimper face. Move up and right into a small sidepull with the right hand. Then pull up, reset that right heel, catch a big kind of sloped sidepull with the left, and finally do a big move to the jug on the  right. Head up the middle of the jug filled arete for a great top out.
content.location: It is on the west arete of Hidden Boulder.

content.description:
Acorn Nightmares starts as far underneath the west face as possible. It starts with the same three or four finger pocket as

Acorn Dreams

, but hold it with the left hand. The right hand starts in a undercling, full pad pocket. Set another heel hook at the bottom of the crimper face. Move right into small left sidepull, and throw to a jug on the right. Dance the feet across to high heel on the far right. Reach up for bomber crimp above your head, and power up for those jugs.
content.location: This is on the west face of the Hidden Boulder.
